About

Genius Annotation

â€œButterâ€ is a dance-pop song with lyrical confessions of sweet, romantic love. The fun and witty lyrics brimming with positive and bright energy will instantly uplift moods. The track uniquely shows each of the BTS' memberâ€™s charms as they show how smooth and at times charismatic, they can be. The song is dubbed as a summer anthem credited to its distinctive bass line and crisp synth sounds, ready to melt the listenerâ€™s heart.

It becomes their second English song following â€œDynamiteâ€ and will receive a more widespread promotion on radio stations. It is also their 3rd track to debut at #1 on the Hot 100, and their 4th track to hit #1 on the Hot 100. The track is produced by Rob Grimaldi, Stephen Kirk, and Ron Perry, the Chairman & CEO of Columbia Records, one of the very few times he is credited as producer on a song.

Q&A

Find answers to frequently asked questions about the song and explore its deeper meaning

What did BTS say about "Butter"?
Verified Commentary
Jimin (ì§€ë¯¼)
via BTS Global Press Conference
Genius Answer

If you hear the title, â€œButter,â€ youâ€™ll know immediately that we tried to prepare a song thatâ€™s easy to listen to, instead of having a heavy or profound message. This is a little bit embarrassing, but a song thatâ€™s smooth like butter [laughs]. A song that sort of melts in to you and grabs hold of you. Itâ€™s a very cute song, sort of a confession. I think you can think of it that way. Like butter, itâ€™s cute, a little bit charismatic. Weâ€™ve tried to put imbue all of these feelings into the song.

What has RM said about co-writing the song?
Verified Commentary
RM
via MTV
Genius Answer

When we first encountered this song â€œButterâ€ was selected among many, many songs. It was already from the guide very complete. We wanted to participate, but it was already very good. For some partsâ€”the rap partsâ€“it wasnâ€™t fully compatible with our style. So I think thatâ€™s what inspired us to participate [RM worked on half of the rap sections from what was originally there]. I didnâ€™t participate just because I speak English. I was lucky to be able to participate in making this song.

Are there any Easter Eggs in the MV?
Genius Answer

In the â€œjailâ€ scene some of the numbers on the name plates are not random. During the V Live after the song release they shared that:

  • V chose 000001 to say that he will become No.1 (itâ€™s based on a Cyworld emotion).
  • SUGAâ€™s 384627 is a random number.
  • Jung Kook chose 110604 as itâ€™s the date when he came to Seoul as a trainee and moved into the dorms.
  • Jinâ€™s 655212 is a random number he typed, but he said that later he googled it and apparently both, 655 and 212, are called â€œangel numbers.â€
  • RMâ€™s 201904 is because his old appartment address (flat 904, building 507). [April 19, 2020 is also the day they performed for the first time at the Grammys]
  • Jimin chose 141018 as itâ€™s a date of their first concert (the concert took place at AX-Korea in Seoul, South Korea and was a part of BTS' The Red Bullet Tour)
  • j-hopeâ€™s 660660 is a famous in South Korea pager code (ì‚ì‚) that looks like ë½€ë½€ (â€˜bbobboâ€™) and means â€˜kiss.â€™

The buttons of the elevator have BTS and ARMY logos, as well as A (ARMY) and B1-B7 (BTS' seven members).

During the line â€œGot ARMY right behind us when we say soâ€ BTS recreated their famous ARMY pose from their early days (2016).
